newsitem.title: USA: Cyrix to continue using chip's audio driver.
newsitem.headline: Cyrix to continue using chip's audio driver.

text.p: Cyrix Corp said on Monday that the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California has determined that Creative Technology can not prevent the use of a Windows 95 audio driver in computer systems based on Cyrix's MediaGX(TM) processor.
The audio driver eliminates the need or cost of a separate sound card for personal computers, Cyrix said.

The court agreed with Cyrix that Creative Technology could not rely on trademark law to prevent use by Cyrix of an audio driver licensed by Creative Technology for inclusion in Microsoft Corp's Windows 95, Cyrix said.
Cyrix said the court adopted Cyrix's suggestion that Creative provide Cyrix with a de-labeled Windows 95 audio driver that does not include any reference to Creative Technology.

The court provided Creative Technology the opportunity to give Cyrix, at no cost, a de-labeled Windows(R) 95 audio driver that will contain all the functionality of the current driver used by the MediaGX(TM) processor, Cyrix said.
If Creative Technology provides a de-labeled driver, then Cyrix will have 60 days to test that it operates as well as the current audio driver for the MediaGX chip, Cyrix said.
